summary:
Construct spiders, guardians, and centurions to fight for you.
Summon Dwarven Soldiers to stand by your side
descriptionHtml:
[color=\"#FF0000\"][b]FEEL FREE TO COMMENT AND [u]REPORT ANY BUGS[/u] IN THIS MOD[/b][/color]
[u]What might come (probably as an optional \"fun\" file starting this weekend[/u]:
- Dwemer Grenades or \"Bombarda\" (attunement sphere model)
- Something to do with puzzle cubes... 
- Heated Dwarven arrows (you can have a bow with 2 enchantments + a fire effect for the projectile).
- Conjure ballista projectiles, or explosive tip arrows?

[center]_______________________ [b]DESCRIPTION[/b] _______________________

COMES WITH A STARTER KIT!
(see Version 3.0 description for more detail)

With this mod you can create a Dwemer Army at any Blacksmith\'s Forge in the [u]Dwarven[/u] section. Arcane Blacksmith is also required for version 4.0.
A list of materials needed for each Automaton is displayed below. 
Automatons are arranged top to bottom from weakest to strongest.
Most Dwemer Parts have been reweighed for less burdensome forging.
Each machine you create will last for [s]5 minutes, or 300 seconds[/s] FOREVER! (unless it dies of course).
Currently, the Automatons are not invincible (I can make a separate ESP of indestructible creations if anyone requests it).
You can find your Automatons on the ITEM - SCROLLS menu.
They will not appear as scrolls but as smaller versions themselves (see picture).
[color=\"#FF0000\"][s]Do not, I repeat, do not drop these items from your inventory (storing works just fine).[/s][/color]
You can now drop them (v4) but I recommend you don\'t!
[u][b]And remember, Endorse or give Kudos if you like this[/b][/u].
(and/or [b]please comment[/b] so I know what you think of the mod) 
But above all, ENJOY THE MOD!

[color=\"#FF0000\"]Version 2.0[/color]
Starter Kit added to the [u]entrance of Muzlft[/u] inside a chest
Contains materials needed to create one Dwarven Spider Worker and a staff that heals your Automatons
Chest respawns every 3 days
As requested, Soul Gems will now be required to forge machines.

[color=\"#FF0000\"]Version 3.0[/color]
Automatons will now stand by you forever (unless they are defeated in battle).
A new list of necessary crafting material has been put up (the old list can also be viewed if you scroll down enough)
In addition to soul gems and paper rolls, Automatons now require a certain amount of ingots depending on their level and a main part-- two for Spheres.
(I figured if you could forge Dwarven items with ingots, you can do the same with cogs, gears, etc.)
The [u]Starter Kit[/u] now includes the materials to make each of the basic types of Automatons (3 in total), or 1 Spider Guardian. The healing rod will now fully restore the health of one Automaton and its newly added partner, the grand healing rod, will restore some health of any Automatons near the casting location of impact.
In summary, forging and healing multiple Automatons has become more manageable.
** In case you did not know, the smelter can take any Dwemer scrap you find and turn it into ingots. **

[color=\"#FF0000\"][b]Version 4.0[/b][/color]
You are now able to forge scrolls that allow you to summon multiple Automatons at the same time (the battle groups are shown on crafting list below)
In addition, 3 other new craft-able scrolls allow you to summon an \"army\":
[b]1st Division[/b]
1 Centurion, 3 Spheres, 5 Spider Workers
[b]2nd Division[/b]
1 Centurion Guardian, 3 Sphere Guardians, 5 Spiders
[b]3rd Division[/b]
1 Centurion Master, 3 Sphere Masters, 5 Spider Guardians
---
All scrolls in V4.0 are forged using other Dwarven Conjure Scrolls
All scrolls have been given new meshes and textures, and now can be dropped (although I still recommend you don\'t)
All scrolls have been given different septim values associated with their effects
The perk, Arcane Blacksmith, is now required to forge Automatons
4 new powers have been added (can be found in starter kit as SpellTomes)
[b]Summon Dwarven Soldier[/b]
Sword and Shield
[b]Summon Dwarven Berserker[/b]
Akimbo War-Axes
[b]Summon Dwarven Archer[/b]
Bow and 9999 Arrows
[b]Summon Dwarven Heavy Trooper[/b]
War-Hammer
These summons last for 5 minutes (300 seconds) and can only be used once a day, but the Dwarves are invulnerable.
THE [b]STARTER KIT[/b] AND [url=file.php?id=6093]MULTIPLE SUMMONS[/url] HAVE BECOME ESSENTIAL FOR THE FULL EXPERIENCE OF THIS MOD
[/center]

[b]Spider Worker[/b] ----------------------------------- Militia (10 Automatons)                     
- Paper Roll (1) 
- Petty Soul Gem- Filled (1)
- Dwarven Ingot (1)
- Dwemer Gyro (1) 

[b]Spider[/b] ---------------------------------------------- Armada (6 Automatons)

- Centurion Dynamo Core (1)

[b]Centurion Guardian[/b] --------------------------- Sentinels (3 Automatons)
- Paper Roll (1)
- Greater Soul Gem- Filled (1)
- Dwarven Ingot (10)
- Centurion Dynamo Core (1)

[b]Centurion Master[/b] ----------------------------- Single summon only (ONE!!!)
- Paper Roll (1)
- Grand Soul Gem- Filled (1)
- Dwarven Ingot (20)
- Centurion Dynamo Core (1)


[center]_______________________ [b]INSTALLATION[/b] _______________________

Place the \"Data\" file in your Skyrim directory, should be:
\"C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Steam\\SteamApps\\common\\skyrim\"
and that\'s it.[/center]

[u]A VERY STRONGLY RECOMMENDED MOD:[/u]
[url=file.php?id=6093]Multiple Summons[/url]
If you want to summon multiple creatures at the same time.
BUT! Remember to place it below the DwarvenArmy.esp in your load order!

MY OTHER MODS
[url=file.php?id=8915]Peryite\'s Blessing[/url]
If you want to vomit on your enemies, rendering them, well... dead.
[url=file.php?id=9517]Shrouded Hood High-Res and Blood-Faded Texture[/url]
A simple retexture...
[url=file.php?id=10422]Enhanced Wolf Armor[/url]
In case you need a little heavy armor and two-handed weapon help.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[center]When compared to [b]Dwemer Certified[/b], my mod is geared towards quantity rather than quality.
If you want a few loyal and powerful Automata (that you can upgrade and temper) to follow you, get [b]Dwemer Certified[/b].
If you want to create a massive army to take down another (and if you like explosions) get [b]Build-A-Dwarven Army[/b].[/center]
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
